com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.business

Interface FolderResource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FileRepositoryResource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AzureFolderResource, SpringIntegrationFolderResource, SpringIntegrationFtpFolderResource, SpringIntegrationSftpFolderResource

    public interface FolderResource
extends FileRepositoryResource
    Represents a single FileRepository folder, identified by a FolderDescriptor.

    This interface has several default methods that implementors can override for performance reasons, usually related to file/folder differences and searching resources.

    Since:
    1.4.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

      • getResource

        FileRepositoryResource getResource(String relativePath)
        Get the resource identified by the relative path. If the target is not a valid resource, an exception should be thrown.

        A path ending with / indicates a folder resource, otherwise a file resource should be returned.

        Parameters:
        relativePath - to the resource
        Returns:
        resource

      • createFileResource

        default FileResource createFileResource()
        Create a new unique (writable) file resource in this folder.
        Returns:
        file resource

      • listFiles

        default Collection<FileResource> listFiles()
        List the file resources that are direct children of this folder. Should return an empty collection if the folder does not exist.
        Returns:
        collection of file resources

      • listFolders

        default Collection<FolderResource> listFolders()
        List the folder resources that are direct children of this folder. Should return an empty collection if the folder does not exist.
        Returns:
        collection of folder resources

      • listResources

        default <U extends FileRepositoryResource> Collection<U> listResources(boolean recurseFolders,
                                                                       Class<U> resourceType)
        List resources that are children of this folder. Depending on the parameter only direct children will be returned (false) or the entire sub-tree will be returned.

        Should return an empty collection if the folder does not exist.

        Parameters:
        recurseFolders - true if child folders should be navigated as well
        resourceType - type of resources that should be returned
        Returns:
        collection of resources

      • listResources

        default Collection<FileRepositoryResource> listResources(boolean recurseFolders)
        List resources that are children of this folder. Depending on the parameter only direct children will be returned (false) or the entire sub-tree will be returned.

        Should return an empty collection if the folder does not exist.

        Parameters:
        recurseFolders - true if child folders should be navigated as well
        Returns:
        collection of resources

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        resources

        resources

      • delete

        boolean delete(boolean deleteChildren)
        Delete this folder. The parameter value indicates if non-empty folders should be deleted after first deleting all children (true) or if the folder should not be deleted if there still are children (false).

        The return value only confirms that delete has failed but does not necessarily ensure that the folder has been deleted. A value of true only indicates that the delete command has been attempted, whereas false implies it has not (because the folder is not empty for example).

        Parameters:
        deleteChildren - true if existing children should also be deleted
        Returns:
        false if delete has failed

      • deleteChildren

        boolean deleteChildren()
        Delete all children of this folder, but not the folder itself.
        Returns:
        true if an attempt has been made to delete all children

      • create

        boolean create()
        Create the folder itself, without adding any files to it. Usually only useful if FileRepositoryResource.exists() returns false.

        Not every file system might support empty folder creation, in which case the return value is expected to be false. Creating a folder that already exists should also not throw an exception but simply return false. Because of this, this method can be used to avoid a call to FileRepositoryResource.exists() if it would be immediately followed by create anyway.

        Returns:
        true if folder has been created - FileRepositoryResource.exists() should return true

      • isEmpty

        default boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the folder does not have any children
